Summary: BRAKES FAILED, CAUSING ACCIDENT. (NEW JERSEY STATE POLICE REPORT)

THE FIRST TIRE FAILED AT ABOUT 70 MPH. THE ENTIRE RUBBER TREAD PEALED AWAY FROM THE TIRE CASING. ALTHOUGH THE CAR SWERVED BADLY I MANAGED TO STOP WITHOUT GETTING INTO AN ACCIDENT. THE PEELING RUBBER CAUSED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE. THE DEALER (STRAUS DISCOUNT AUTO) REFUSED TO ACCEPT ANY RESPONSIBILITY AND SAID "IT WAS NOT A MANUFACTURING DEFECT". ABOUT 2 MONTHS LATER THE RIGHT SIDE TIRE FAILED AT ABOUT THE SAME SPEED, (AGAIN CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE.)( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: P215 75R15 )

WHILE DEFECTIVE TURN SIGNAL WAS ON, SMOKE CAME FROM THE STEERING COLUMN AND UNDERNEATH THE DASH,  CAUSING A ELECTRICAL FIRE WHICH CAUSED HARM TO THE OCCUPANT. MFR IS AWARE OF PROBLEM, BUT HASN'T FIXED THE VEHICLE. MANUFACTURER TOLD OCCUPANT NOT TO CONTACT NHTSA.   *AK

IN 1991 CONSUMER PURCHASED A FULL SET OF BRIDGESTONE, DUELERS.  TWO OF THE TIRES WERE MOUNTED, ABOUT TWO YEARS LATER, WHILE DRIVING AT 60 MPH, ONE OF THE TIRES BLEW OUT.  FOUR YEARS LATER, THE SECOND TIRE BLEW OUT. ALSO, A COUPLE OF MONTHS LATER, THIRD TIRE SUFFERED AN INTERNAL FAILURE, WHICH CAUSED THE TIRE TO LOSE IT'S FLATNESS AND BECOME "V" SHAPED.   CJBECOME "V" SHAPED.   CJ

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1971 FORD F-350.  THE VEHICLE HAS TWO REAR FUJIAMI ENDURO TIRES, SIZE LT 235/85R16 EPLY (NA).  WHILE DRIVING 35-60 MPH, THE VEHICLE WANDER OVER THE ROAD.  THE VEHICLE HAS TO BE SLOWED DOWN TO LESS THAN 60 MPH FOR THE CONTACT TO REMAIN IN CONTROL.  HE STATED THAT HE FEELS LIKE HE IS DRIVING ON ICE.  IT IS VERY DIFFICULT AND DANGEROUS TO DRIVE WITH THESE TIRES ON THE VEHICLE.  THE CONTACT HAD PLACED APPROX. 100 MILES ON THE TIRES AT THE TIME THEY WERE REMOVED.  THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 300,000.  UPDATED 09/15/08 *BF       THE CONSUMER STATED HE REPLACED THE TIRES AND THE PROBLEM HAS BEEN RECTIFIED. UPDATED 09/17/08. *JB

1. IF THE TRUCK WAS NOT MOVED IN A COUPLE DAYS U HAD TO BLEED THE BRAKES BACK OUT SO REPLACED ALL THE LINE AND WHEEL SEALS.  2.THE BRAKE LEAK DOWN AND THEN I DON'T HAVE BREAKS IT OCCURS EVERY 2 TO 3 DAYS I HAVE TO ADD FLUID   3.I TOOK IT TO THE FORD PLACE BY THE HOUSE AND THE MECHANIC SAID THERE WAS 2 RECALLS WITH THE BRAKES ON THE TRUCKS  AND HE SAID TO CONTACT U AND HE GAVE ME THE NUMBERS OF THE RECALLS THE FIRST ONE IS 71V024000 OR 7IV025000 THE SECOND IS 71V025000 OR 7IV024000 HE SAID YA'LL WOULD HAVE TO SEND A PAPER SO HE COULD GET THE PARTS AND FIX IT FOR ME. BEING THAT THERE WAS A RECALL. *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1972 FORD F600 DUMP TRUCK(NA).  HE PURCHASED TWO CARLISLE INNER TUBES ALONG WITH TWO NEW TIRES. WHILE DRIVING THE PASSENGER FRONT TIRE  BLEW-OUT. HE REPLACED THE TIRE WITH A SPARE TIRE.  AFTER DRIVING FOR APPROXIMATELY 100 MILES, THE OTHER NEW TIRE BLEW OUT. HE SPECULATED THAT THE INNER TUBES  CAUSED THE TIRES TO FAIL. THE SALESMAN THAT SOLD HIM THE TIRE STATED THAT THEY WERE COMMUNICATING  WITH THE MANUFACTURER REGARDING THE FAILURE. THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 76,116. THE VEHICLE IDENTIFICATION NUMBER WAS UNAVAILABLE.

PURCHASED A TOTAL OF FOUR TIRES FROM L.R. HOOK TIRE CO.,P.O. BOX 1154, LEXINGTON, S.C. 29072 (FIRESTONE FRANCHISED DEALER). THE FAILURE THAT OCCURRED WAS THE TOTAL SEPARATION OF THE TREAD FROM THE TIRE. EVEN THOUGH I HAD HAZZARD INSURANCE ON ALL OF THE TI( DOT NUMBER: VDHL1M6X49 TIRE SIZE: 23575R-15 )
THE TREAD ON THE RIGHT REAR FIRESTONE TIRE SEPARATED, HIT AND DAMAGED THE FENDER AND THE TIRE BLEWOUT.  NLM

WHILE DRIVING AT NORMAL SPEED  CONSUMER STATES WHEN APPLING BRAKES, THE BRAKE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR.  CONSUMER HAD TO USE EMERGENCY PARKING BRAKE TO STOP.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.  PH

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1971 PLYMOUTH SATELLITE EQUIPPED WITH DILLACP TR-413 255/45/17 TIRES. THE CONTACT STATED THAT AFTER NOTICING A RECCURING FAILURE WITH THE TIRES, THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A LOCAL MECHANIC WHO DIAGNOSED THAT THE VEHICLE HAD FAULTY VALVE STEMS AND THEY WOULD NEED TO BE REPLACED. THE VALVE STEMS WERE REPLACED. THE DEALER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 147,000 AND THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 160,000. THE VIN WAS UNAVAILABLE.
PLASTIC END BROKE OFF THE TURN SIGNAL ARM LEAVING SHARP POINT EXPOSED. *SD

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1968 (NA) ROAD RUNNER EQUIPPED WITH FOUR BILLET SPECIALTIES STREET LITE WHEELS (NA), SIZE: 15X6, PART NUMBER: BSP-RS035606535N. WHILE OPERATING THE VEHICLE, A VIBRATION WAS PRESENT COMING FROM THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE. IT WAS LATER DISCOVERED THAT THE FRONT DRIVER SIDE WHEEL WAS CRACKED AND PUNCTURED THE TIRE, CAUSING IT TO FLATTEN. THE CAUSE OF THE FAILURE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 500.

TOYOTA/LEXUS SUDDEN ACCELERATION PROBLEM.   *NJ  THE CONSUMER STATED IN THE EARLY 1980'S HE OWNED A 1971 TOYOTA CELICA WHICH DEVELOPED A PROBLEM WITH ITS AUTOMATIC CHOKE SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM WAS BASED ON AN EXPANSION/CONTRACTION COIL WHICH REACTED TO AMBIENT TEMPERATURES TO ADJUST FUEL FLOW. THE CONSUMER STATED THAT WAS HOW IT WAS EXPLAINED TO HIM.  WHENEVER MOISTURE GOT INTO THE ELEMENT, THE VEHICLE ACCELERATED RAPIDLY.  THE CONSUMER HAD TO QUICKLY PRESS THE CLUTCH, DISENGAGING THE ENGINE FROM THE POWER TRAIN WHILE TRYING AT THE SAME TIME TO APPLY THE BRAKES.  THE CONSUMER STATED EVEN THOUGH ELECTRONICS AND COMPUTER TECHNOLOGIES CONTROL VARIOUS SYSTEMS, IT WAS THE HARDWARE FAILURE THAT RULED IN THE END. THE CONSUMER STATED IF TOYOTA HAS NOT CHANGED THE BASIC DESIGN OF THE HARDWARE IT HAS BEEN AND WILL REMAIN A SAFETY PROBLEM.  *JB

WHILE TRAVELING AT APPROXIMATELY 50 TO 55 MPH RIGHT REAR FIRESTONE TIRE SIZE P185/75R14, DOT: W2J71JL234) ON 1971, VOLKSWAGEN BUS EXPERIENCED TREAD SEPARATION.  TIRE WAS NOT ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT ON  VEHICLE,  AND HAD LESS THAN 8,000 MILES ON IT.  *AK *JB
SUDDEN ACCELERATION, CAUSING LOSS OF CONTROL/ACCIDENT.  (NEW JERSEY STATE POLICE REPORT).  *SKD
